text: every time I see someone doing email on
a blackberry phone or a trio I think to
myself is it just my imagination or are
those things just huge and what about
making phone calls on those things I
mean am I crazy or are those things just
to awkwardly shaped
and there's another problem with those
blackberrys sort of phones the kids are
thrilled I've seen people become
addicted to the house looks fabulous
hold on a second my goodness finally oh
it's just my boss this weekend the times
I reviewed 3 free services that send
your email to any cell phone doesn't
have to be a blackberry one of them is
called gmail for mobile it brings to
your cell phone screen the entire
contents of your gmail account looking
exactly like it does on the web it even
recreates the conversations feature
which clumps together the back and forth
on a certain topic all the usual email
commands are here complete with handy
keyboard shortcuts you can even open
attachments Microsoft Word photos and
PDF files for example the only downside
of this awesome free piece of software
is that it requires a phone that runs
the java programming language which
rules out all verizon cell phones you
could say the same for yahoo go the beta
version of a new program for people with
free yahoo mail accounts yahoo go
incorporates eight different modules
news photos weather and so on and only
one of them is email unfortunately yahoo
go runs on even fewer cell phone models
and again no verizon that's why the
cleverest free service of all is the one
called telefe lip it's very simple
whenever someone sends an email to your
address teleconverter into text messages
which can go to any cell phone in the
world of course text messages are very
short limited to 120 characters so you
have to page through a number of them to
read the whole email and on the
telekinetic app on how many text
messages come from each one also telef
lips ends on only the emails that come
from a list of approved email addresses
you've specified to screen out spam and
other time wasters now remember although
these services don't charge anything
they do require an internet data
a text messaging plan from your cell
phone company but for me that's a small
price to pay now I don't have to worry
what other people think when they look
at me hey David what you doing oh no
that much I'm try out a new service that
lets me get my email right on my cell
phone oh that's nice it's cool isn't it
okay well I'll see you later
you
it's pretty cool
